---
title: Customizing Tooltips
path: /customizing-tooltips/
index: 3
---

import Tippy from '../components/Tippy'
import { Button } from '../components/Framework'

As seen in the demo, the `tippy()` function takes an object of options as a
second argument to customize the tooltips:

```js
tippy('button', {
  animation: 'scale',
  duration: 0,
  arrow: true,
  delay: [1000, 200],
})
```

You can also specify options on the element using data attributes:

```html
<button
  data-tippy-animation="scale"
  data-tippy-duration="0"
  data-tippy-arrow="true"
  data-tippy-delay="[800, 200]"
>
  Text
</button>
```

Note that only JSON values are valid in attributes.

It can be useful to use the function for "global" settings and choose attributes
for individual settings here and there:

```html
<button>Default</button>
<button data-tippy-content="hello">I have my own content</button>
<button data-tippy-arrow="true">I have my own option</button>
```

```js
// Global settings for all <button>s
tippy('button', {
  content: 'global content',
  animation: 'fade',
})
```

### Default options

Often you don't want to specify options over and over again when initializing
tooltips. You can set the default options for every tooltip with the
`tippy.setDefaults()` method:

```js
tippy.setDefaults({
  animation: 'fade',
  arrow: true,
})
```

You can place this call directly after the scripts to set the defaults for
auto-initialized tooltips:

```html
<!-- script links here -->
<script>
  tippy.setDefaults({
    // Your options here
  })
</script>
```
